items: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Hold this position for a few seconds, then shift your weight to your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground.
Bring your right knee up towards your chest, then rotate your ankle in a circular motion.
Lower your right foot back to the ground and repeat the same movement with your left foot.
Next, lift your right foot off the ground again and extend it out in front of you.
Hold this position for a few seconds, then bring your right foot back to the ground and repeat with your left foot.
Finally, stand up and repeat the entire sequence for several reps.
Strengthens lower body muscles such as quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes
Improves core stability and balance
Increases shoulder mobility and flexibility
Engages upper body muscles such as deltoids, trapezius, and latissimus dorsi
Enhances overall body coordination and control
Can be modified for different fitness levels and goals
